events.welcome:
**Thanks for adding me to the server!**

Type `{{channelCommand}}` to set up a channel and then `{{enableCommand}}` to enable me üòÅ. After collecting {{min}} messages, I'll start generating content üëÄ. Type `{{infoCommand}}` for more information.

For every 30 days of inactivity we delete the stored texts. If you want to delete the texts, use the command `{{deleteCommand}}`. The parameter `{{member}}` can be used by the command user or whoever has the message management permission.

faq.title: FAQ
faq.description: Questions? Maybe this can help you. Unlisted questions can be asked in my server.

fields.name: How do I delete stored messages?
fields.value: You can delete stored messages using the command `{{deleteCommand}}`. Providing the parameter `{{parameter}}` allows you to delete messages from yourself or a member.

fields.name: I don't want it to collect my messages!
fields.value: To disable the collection of your messages, type `{{trackingCommand}}`. Type the same command to enable it again.

fields.name: Are the messages updated?
fields.value: Yes. When any message is edited or deleted, if the bot is online and enabled, it will update the stored data.

fields.name: Does this bot use any complex AI?
fields.value: No. The bot uses [Markov Chains](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Markov_chain), a very simple algorithm that works with probabilities, used in the text generation.

fields.name: He's generating many non-sense sentences!
fields.value: Currently there's no filter of what is a correct sentence or not, so the bot will randomly try to generate something, which sometimes relates to the context. A lower limit of texts is recommended so he can "assembles the puzzle" more accurately.

fields.name: How was this bot made?
fields.value: The bot was developed using [TypeScript](https://www.typescriptlang.org) (an improvement on JavaScript), using [Discord.js](https://discord.js.org) in [Node.js](https://nodejs.org/en/about). Initially the database was a [JSON](https://pt.wikipedia.org/wiki/JSON) file, but soon [MongoDB](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MongoDB) was used. Currently hosted on a [friend's]({{friendURL}}) host at [DigitalOcean](https://digitalocean.com/).

fields.name: Do you have any plans to scale the bot?
fields.value: I'm uncertain about this. The bot started as a study and hobby suggested by friends. As I'm still a young student, I can't afford to keep the bot for a long time, but I'm trying to do my best. The source code is on GitHub if you want to host your own instance.
